101.description: The development world has gone Agile crazy. The de facto way to develop and launch software today is in sprints. Fantastic! Wait! say the CEO, the CMO and the Head of BD in unison! We still want you to provide a project plan with a list of activities, launch dates and milestones so we can plan our Go-to-Market strategy, our Comms plan and commit to our partners for the joint Launch campaign. You're the captain of this ship e.g. the Project Manager. You figure it out! Let's talk about your unfair role in this new world (and why they pay you the big bucks to be in that position
101.title: Today's Project Manager: the performer of weddings between Agile development and Waterfall management!

102.description: Dive deep into machine learning with TensorFlow is a high-level introduction to the TensorFlow library, architecture and API. Originally developed at Google for the purposes of conducting machine-learning and deep neural networks research, TensorFlow leverages a general computational model that is applicable in a wide variety of other domains, especially for performing large-scale numerical computations on large data. This talk explains you how to use the library to train machine-learning models and make your next application smarter.
102.title: Dive deep into machine learning with TensorFlow

103.description: Often, designing for the user seems like a whimsical idea of the UX team. Both clients and the team may see it as a waste of time or something as something that is just too much of a luxury. This talk will focus on how most of the justifications against designing for the user are complete nonsense. We’ll also explore some simple ways of making the user an integral part of your processo. The world is changing and ignoring a user should no longer be an option.
103.title: Cutting past the bullshit and designing for the user

104.description: Having solid, high quality APIs for your application is crucial and more important than ever especially in today’s microservice architectures. While there are many ways to do it, having a good combination of methodology with a robust infrastructure can really make the difference. During this talk you’ll see how to deploy a Python microservice on the Google Cloud using Connexion (Flask based framework), App Engine Flexible (platform as a service) and Cloud Endpoints (API gateway) following API first principles.
104.title: Going API First on the Google Cloud with Connexion

105.description: We will dive into WebVR using Mozilla's A-Frame library.
105.title: Virtual Reality with A-Frame

106.description:
In some forms of philosophy, it is believed that language determines the scope of human intelligence. If there are no words to express it, it can not be understood. On the web, this is something that is known for quite some time. The Semantic Web, coined by Tim Berners-Lee, was a first and important step in gathering the vast amount of knowledge available on the web.
In this talk, we will look not only at the digital but the physical. How can the Internet of Things help us to create a knowledge repository to understand the world? How can we use tools like the cloud (GCP), graph-databases and schema.org (Google’s RDF-IoT extension) and what can we learn from social networks like Facebook and Google+ to truly understand our world. We will look at classical IoT and new forms of IoT.
“Devices are so 2017, the future is a semantic Internet of Things”
106.title: A Semantic Internet of Things

107.description:
What if life was so awesome that we could work and go on vacation at the same time?
The growth of the Internet and the improvement of communications have brought disruption, change and new opportunities. We no longer need to be confined to a city or space, to be able to produce and be successful.  Come discover what might as well be your future, and learn about what I've been doing for the past 12 months.
107.title: World Citizen

108.description: We will explore how to boost the usability of web and mobile-web apps by implementing offline-first functionalities, it's the only way to guarantee 100% always on user experience. Low signal or no connectivity should no longer be a blocker for the user, we will discuss the available solutions for caching, in-browser database, and data replication. We will also take a look at how WC help solving those issues out of the box.
108.title: Offline-first apps with WebComponents

109.description: For over 2 years Google´s People Operations team was trying to find the perfect mix of individual traits and skills necessary for a stellar team. However, they ended up concluding that who is on a team matters less than how the team members interact, structure their work, and view their contributions. At a time when we are all focus on company culture and how it affects attractiveness of new team members, are we connecting all the dots till teams effectiveness?
109.title: Do great teams grow on trees?

110.description: Location is the common base for something that is happening or can happen anywhere. Where we come from, where we work, where we live - these are all ways of making sense of the world around us - how can we leverage businesses with this kind of knowledge? In this session, we'll dive into how the location component can be part of any solution,  and how can we delivery it in effective ways using Google Maps API, Google Cloud and Google IoT Solutions.
110.title: The Sense of Location on any Business

994.description: Google itself says that is now not a mobile first but Artificial Intelligence first, more and more we see software and apps with AI, what impact will the have? We have invited variosu experts to debate.
994.title: OPEN - Artificial Intelligence Debate

995.description: We invite all the speakers to come on stage and start a discussion with the community.
995.title: Fireside Discussion

996.description: Coffee Break! Why not go say hello to the fellows at the Community Corner?
996.title: Coffee Break

998.description: The talks will begin with this open ceremony where the organizers of the event will give a quick word and news. Let's Go!
998.title: Open Ceremony

speakers.bio:
I have recently joined DSSC, a growing Fintech startup as their Head of Operations & PMO. Previously, I was a Senior Programme Manager at Skype, managing the delivery of Online Payments programmes mainly in Emerging markets, enabling millions of users to buy Skype paid services. In my spare time, I run Charub, an early stage Social Enterprise raising money for charities through the use of online advertising and social media.
 
I few years ago, I was a Project Manager and Developer at e-pay, a Euronet Worldwide company, working on top-up integration projects with Retailers such as Tesco, Sainsbury's and Asda and service providers like Vodafone, Orange and Apple iTunes.
 
Before my UK adventures, I lived in South Africa for a couple of years where I was a Computer Science instructor in a Pretoria college. My first work experience was in my native Portugal as a Computer Science lecturer at the University I graduated from with a BA+Honours in Computer Science and Business Management.
speakers.name: Ana Ribeiro
speakers.shortBio: I have recently joined DSSC, a growing Fintech startup as their Head of Operations & PMO. Previously, I was a Senior Programme Manager at Skype...
speakers.title: Head of Operations & PMO

speakers.bio: Mário Cordeiro is a Senior Software Engineer at Critical Manufacturing and a PhD student in the Doctoral Program in Informatics Engineering at Porto University. He is currently researching Event detection in social network data streams, a cross domain research topic in the areas of Social network analysis, Natural Language Processing and Data Stream Mining. Co-organizer of the Data Science Portugal community.
speakers.name: Mário Cordeiro
speakers.shortBio: Mário Cordeiro is a Senior Software Engineer at Critical Manufacturing and a PhD student in the Doctoral Program in Informatics Engineering at Porto University.

speakers.bio: With over 17 years of design experience in various fields, Hugo has become an evangelist for UX and Design thinking. Trying to help others understand the benefits of these two methodologies by speaking at events and teaching the UX at EDIT. One of Hugo's favorite pastimes is discussing how to use design to make the_world a better place and he has recently become a board member of UX for Change.
speakers.name: Hugo Froes Simões
speakers.shortBio: Trying to help others understand the benefits of UX and Designing Thinking on step at a time. Let’s solve problems together.
speakers.title: UX Designer/Strategist/Evangelist at Hi INTERACTIVE and Co-creator of UX Discuss

speakers.bio: David is a Software Engineer at Zalando SE and part of the Google Developer Expert (GDE) program for Google Cloud. He is based in Berlin, Germany but he comes originally from Bogotá, Colombia. For the past few years, he has been developing applications for cloud platforms in different kinds of projects ranging from marketing tech to enterprise software to IoT. In his spare time he enjoys travelling, running and cycling.
speakers.name: David Cifuentes
speakers.shortBio: David is a Software Engineer at Zalando SE and part of the Google Developer Expert (GDE) program for Google Cloud.
speakers.title: Software Engineer @ Zalando SE, Google Developer Expert

speakers.bio: Martin is open source contributor and web evangelist by heart from Zurich with a decade experience from the trenches of software engineering in multiple fields. He works as a software engineer at Archilogic in front- and backend. He devotes his time to moving the web forward, fixing problems, building applications and systems and breaking things for fun & profit. Martin believes in the web platform and is working with bleeding edge technologies that will allow the web to prosper.
speakers.name: Martin Splitt
speakers.shortBio: Martin is pretty decent at humaning and pretty good at computering,so he decided to use his computering to improve his and other's humaning. He loves the open web and open source and helps to make things better with, but not limited to, code.
speakers.title: Head of Engineering @ Archilogic, Google Developer Expert

speakers.bio:
Bob is a creative technologist and designer who works at the intersection of technology, design, and art. He started his career as a freelance software developer during his art studies, and founded his company Kubrickology right after receiving his bachelor's degree. Bob helps other companies find new business opportunities by implementing and researching new technologies, such as Internet of Things, machine learning, and more. Bob also blogs and makes tech-art installations, which you can read about on his website - or follow his activity on Github.
Currently, Bob is hired to lead the global Internet of Things platform endeavour at the ING Bank, part of ING’s corporate accelerator to create the first artificial intelligence led business models and consultant for several enterprises in Europe.
speakers.name: Bob van Luijt
speakers.shortBio: Bob (GDE) is a creative technologist and designer who works at the intersection of technology, design, and art. He started his career as a freelance software developer during his art studies, and founded his company Kubrickology right after receiving his bachelor's degree.
speakers.title: Software Engineer @ Kubrickology, Google Developer Expert

speakers.bio:
I'm a Software Engineer, working since 2000 with the Web and the Internet.
In 2013 I was presented with the first W3C Web Components draft and Polymer.
At the end of that same year, I presented a Polymer CodeLab at the annual W3C Brazil conference.
Lately, I'm working remotely with a team based in the USA, migrating Salvation Army's old systems to powerful web technologies, and at the same time, traveling the world. This November(2017), my world expedition completes 12 months.
speakers.name: Sam Carecho
speakers.shortBio: Working remotely with a team based in the USA, migrating Salvation Army's old systems to powerful web technologies

speakers.bio: International technical speaker, Google developer expert (GDE), trainer and developer advocate. Passionate about Web and Mobile apps development, including PWA, offline-first design, in-browser database, and cross platform tools. Also interested in Android internals such as building custom ROMs and customize AOSP for embedded devices. amahdy.net
speakers.name: Amahdy AbdElAziz
speakers.shortBio: Technical speaker, GDE, trainer & developer advocate @vaadin. Passionate about Web & Mobile apps development, PWA, offline-first, Android internals, and AOSP.
speakers.title: Software Engineer @ Kubrickology, Google Developer Expert

speakers.bio: Starting her academic and professional career as a pharmacist, she has turned her life round and moved to technology. Today, she’s the COO of Redlight Software, a healthcare software company. Responsible, among other areas, for HR, sees in the internal culture of companies a great potential and a very interesting way of marking the identity of a company, the teams and the products/services they provide. Among other causes that move her and interests in which she invests her personal time, we could emphasize the special interest on sustainable social entrepreneurship and the application of AI in chatbots.
speakers.name: Cláudia Matos Morgado
speakers.shortBio: Having made all of her academic and professional career in health as a pharmacist, a turnaround in life has taken her to ​​technology and today is COO of Redlight Software.
speakers.title: COO at Redlight Software

speakers.bio: Sérgio Santos is a founder and developer at Bloco, a product studio specialised in Android. After a long time as a full-stack web developer, he decided to switch to mobile development and haven't returned since. Interested in software quality and building great products.
speakers.name: Sérgio Santos
speakers.shortBio: Founder and Android developer at Bloco.
speakers.title: Founder and Android developer at Bloco

speakers.bio: Jorge Silva Martins is a lawyer primarily focused on the technology and telecommunications sectors. He has also a significant background in Internet and e-commerce law, providing advice on data protection, privacy, intellectual property, payments and consumer protection related matters. As a lawyer, Jorge is deeply committed to understand and explore the intersections between law and technology.
speakers.name: Jorge Silva Martins
speakers.shortBio: Media, Tech & Telecoms Lawyer. Always exploring new possibilities and new ways to create impact
speakers.title: Lawyer, DLA Piper ABBC

speakers.bio: Art, music and tech lover! Founder and Managing Partner at Focus BC - EMEA Google Enterprise Partner - and EngSolvers and also teach in portuguese universities. Engineer with more than 10 years of professional experience in the area of information systems working as Director in Technical, Research and Development areas. I've participated as Project Manager and Director in several international and national projects, such as: NC3A - NATO; Geocapital Holding; AICEP Global Parks; Chronopost International; Portuguese Geographic Institute, Portugal National Roads Agency, National Direction for Spatial Planning and Urban Development; The Sports Institute of Portugal and Many Local and Central Governemnt organizations. Specialties: Location Intelligence, Leadership, Information Systems, Management, Project Management, Defense and Security, Engineering, Geographic Information Systems, Presentations
speakers.company: Focus BC - Google for work EMEA Partner
speakers.name: Sandro Batista
speakers.shortBio: Art, music and tech lover! Founder and Managing Partner at Focus BC - EMEA Google Enterprise Partner - and EngSolvers with more than 10 years of professional experience in the area of information systems working as Director in Technical, Research and Development areas.
speakers.title: Founder and Managing Partner

speakers.bio: Bruno Nobre is Jesuit Priest, and a Professor of Philosophy at the Catholic University of Portugal (Braga). He earned his Licentiate in Physics Engineering (2000) and his PhD in Physics at Instituto Superior Técnico, Lisbon (2005). He studied Philosophy at the Faculty of Philosophy and Social Sciences, Catholic University, Braga (2007-2010), and obtained his Master’s degree (MDiv) in Theology at Boston College (2016). He was a Postdoctoral researcher in Philosophy of Science at Universidade do Estado do Rio de Janeiro (2016-2017). He is the co-author, with Pedro Lind, of Dois Dedos de Conversa Sobre o Dentro das Coisas, and published several academic articles.
speakers.company: Faculdade de Filosofia e Ciências Sociais, Universidade Católica Portuguesa
speakers.name: Bruno Nobre
speakers.shortBio: Bruno Nobre is a Jesuit Priest, and a Professor of Philosophy at the Catholic University of Portugal (Braga). His academic background is in Physics (Particle Physics).
speakers.title: Professor of Philosophy
